parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Allows to select the actual fields to be returned. When no fields are defined, all are returned.

parameters.name: filter

schema.example: name eq "My Automation" and runMode eq "scheduled" and ownerId eq "sWYAHxZxhtcmBT7Ptc5xJ5I6N7HxwnEy"

parameters.description: Allowed filters: name, runMode, lastRunStatus, ownerId, spaceId

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of automations to retrieve.

parameters.name: listAll
parameters.description: When true, list all automations. Restricted to tenant admins and analytics admins.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to sort by, with +- prefix indicating sort order. (?query=-name => sort on the name field using descending order)

get.description: Retrieves a list of the automations that the requesting user has access to.

post.description: Creates a new automation. The requesting user must be assigned the `AutomationCreator` role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Allows to select the actual fields to be returned. Where the default is all fields

get.description: Retrieves the full definition of an automation. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

put.description: Updates the full definition of an automation. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

delete.description: Deletes an automation. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation, or be assigned the `TenantAdmin` role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

post.description: Changes the owner of an automation to another user. This action removes the history and change logs of this automation. All linked connections used in the automation are detached and not moved to the new owner.

userId.description: The unique identifier of the new owner.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

post.description: Changes the space of an automation by specifying a new space.

spaceId.description: The unique identifier of the new space.

id.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

post.description: Duplicates an existing automation. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

post.description: Disables an automation so that it cannot be run. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation, or be assigned the `TenantAdmin` role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

post.description: Enables an automation so that it can be run. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation, or be assigned the `TenantAdmin` role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

post.description: Changes the owner of an automation to another user. This action removes the history and change logs of this automation. All linked connections used in the automation are detached and not moved to the new owner.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Allows to select the actual fields to be returned. Where the default is all fields

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Allowed filters: status, context, startTime and title, spaceId, ownerId, executedById

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of runs to retrieve.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to sort by, with +- prefix indicating sort order. (?query=-startTime => sort on the startTime field using descending order)

get.description: Retrieves a list of runs for a specific automation. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation, or be assigned the `TenantAdmin` role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

post.description: Creates a runs for a specific automation. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: runId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the run.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Allows to select the actual fields to be returned. Where the default is all fields

get.description: Retrieves a specific run for an automation. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: runId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the run.

post.description: Retrieves the URL for the debug log of a specific automation run. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: runId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the run.

post.description: Retries a specific run by creating a new run using the same inputs. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

parameters.name: runId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the run.

post.description: Forcefully stops an automation run immediately. The requesting user must be the owner of the automation.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Indicates how the metrics should be filtered

parameters.name: breakdownBy
parameters.description: If specified, result will be broken apart for each automation

get.description: Retrieves paginated usage metrics for automations. The requesting user must be assigned the `TenantAdmin` role.

workspace.description: The workspace generated by the Qlik Automate editor.
The workspace generated by the Qlik Automate editor.

snippetIds.description: A list of snippets that were detected inside the workspace. This includes snippet blocks that are not connected to other blocks. Order of guids is not guaranteed.

endpointIds.description: A list of endpoints that were detected inside the workspace. This includes Endpoints present in blocks which are not connected to other blocks. Order of guids is not guaranteed.

connectorIds.description: A list of connectors that were detected the workspace. This includes Connectors present in blocks which are not connected to other blocks. Order of guids is not guaranteed.

duration.description: Duration of the last run, indicated in seconds. Calculated from start and stop times

workspace.description: The workspace contains the JSON representation of the used blocks

snippetIds.description: A list of snippets that were detected inside the workspace. This includes snippet blocks that are not connected to other blocks. Order of guids is not guaranteed.

endpointIds.description: A list of endpoints that were detected inside the workspace. This includes Endpoints present in blocks which are not connected to other blocks. Order of guids is not guaranteed.

connectorIds.description: A list of connectors that were detected the workspace. This includes Connectors present in blocks which are not connected to other blocks. Order of guids is not guaranteed.

guid.description: The unique identifier for the automation.

ownerId.description: The unique identifier for the user who owns the automation

duration.description: Duration of the last run, indicated in seconds. Calculated from start and stop times

code.description: The unique code for the error

title.description: A summary of what went wrong

detail.description: May be used to provide additional details

traceId.description: A way to trace the source of the error.

href.description: The URL to a resource request

context.description: The source that triggers the automation will set the context.

The source that triggers the automation will set the context. Certain contexts impact the execution of an automation (for example, The "test_run" context will not process all results when listing items).

rxBytes.description: Total amount of received bytes sent by the current block.

txBytes.description: Total amount of sent bytes sent by the current block.

apiCalls.description: API calls to external resources made by the current block.

snippetId.description: Unique identifier for the snippet block used within the execution.

endpointId.description: Unique identifier for the snippet block used within the execution.

connectorId.description: Unique identifier for the connector used within the block of the execution.

items.description: Information of the ended execution per block.

blocks.description: List of blocks used during execution. Note: this list currently only contains endpointBlocks and snippetBlocks

totalApiCalls.description: The number of API calls made.

duration.description: Duration of the run, indicated in seconds. Calculated from start and stop times

value.description: The value count of the metric

region.description: The region the tenant is hosted in

tenant.description: Name of the tenant that will be called
